website_summaries.verdict: Chaco's reputation for crafting excellent quality sandals is evident in the Chaco Z/Volv. This model was a standout for wearers because of its superb comfort, support and stylish colors. However, it does come with some flaws like strap adjustment issues and extended break-in period. Overall, this Chaco product delivers a promising performance, but only after it has been broken in.
pros: The Chaco Z/Volv was comfortable according to a good number of impressed owners
A handful of non-Chaco fans tried the Z/Volv and were quite enthralled by its overall feel
Tens of buyers mentioned that this sandal was worth the money they spent
Many wearers were satisfied with its overall performance, so they bought multiple pairs
Plenty of Z/Volv owners liked the sandal for being lighter than their other Chacos
Most testers loved the style of this hiker
A good number of buyers appreciated the wide range of color options
Some wearers, including those with plantar fasciitis, gushed about the support this hiker afforded them
A good number of owners vouched for the durability of this sandal
Scores of wearers liked the flexibility of the Z/Volv
cons: A handful of wearers complained that the straps of the Chaco Z/Volv were a bit difficult to adjust
It was challenging to get the right fit in the first few tries
A majority of buyers said that the sandals needed some break-in time

customer_reviews.title: Sport Version is Better then Classic
customer_reviews.text: I own classic Chocos as well, but the Zvolv sport are my favorite. They fit to the contours of my foot best, with a deep heal for heal and arch support. I use them for adventure exploring in Hawaii. I am a private adventure guide in Maui, so the Zvolv's are fantastic for hiking in and out of streams, rock hopping, jumping waterfalls, I even keep them on when swimming in waterfall pools. The straps are very strong, adjustable, and the soles are flexible and sturdy. This is my second pair of ZVolv's because I lost my first pair after a year. So, I've had a lot of experience with these already.
customer_reviews.author: Demian Deas

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I overall love these sandals. Getting the straps to fit just right each time I wear them is slightly annoying but once I get it right they are the most comfortable sandals. I do not typically have to wear wide shoes but I found the woman’s chacos to be a bit narrow so I used Amazon Wardrobe and had a few of the men’s chacos sent to me. It was awesome to be able to try on many choices and then send back what I didn’t want without it costing me anything. I wear a woman’s 11 but men’s 10 fit just right.
customer_reviews.author: OhanaMama

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable to walk in.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like these sandals as they felt really cluncky because the sole was so thick. I'm not sure how these are so popular but maybe other people use a different version. They don't really bend at all when I walk. Although one thing I do like is the minimalist strap design but that's all it's got going for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Robinson

customer_reviews.title: best
customer_reviews.text: these are my fave. The straps fit and wear with my feet. They don't care about weather, water, dirt, rock, sand. And they are wide enough for my giant feet. I keep trying to find sandals i like better, but I never have. I have stopped looking and just buy these when the old ones wear out after years of hard wearing.
customer_reviews.author: EJTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not as great as original Chacos
customer_reviews.text: I had had a pair of original Chacos that had lasted me for years until our most recent puppy found them when I forgot to put them away. Hence the new pair. They are absolutely as comfortable as my prior pair, but the soles aren't as thick and the tread isn't the hiking-shoe design as was my old pair. Regardless, they still perform quite well on semi-gravely hikes, but I wouldn't wear them on more difficult hikes like I did my last pair. Still, I would recommend them definitely for casual and easy hiking wear.
customer_reviews.author: BigDave

customer_reviews.title: Lighter but not as form-fitting as original
customer_reviews.text: If you love the arch support and pod-style feel of the original Z1's, don't buy the Zvolv. Yes, they are noticeably lighter, but they don't mold to the feet like my original Chacos.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Owens

customer_reviews.title: Much better than flops to me
customer_reviews.text: I think they are GR8!..so versatile. Much better than flops to me. Can slip on and off without bending over if adjusted loosely OR can run in them if adjusted to snug fit. Sand at beach or light work at home. Have 3 pair now for me and more for fam gifts...
customer_reviews.author: Rick G.

customer_reviews.title: It's a Chaco
customer_reviews.text: The strap material is a little lighter than the z classic but overall an awesome sandal. This is my 3rd pair of Chaco's in 24 years... That's like a pair every 8 years... That's a pretty good track record in my book...
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Carrier

customer_reviews.title: hubby was a hater then he wore them...
customer_reviews.text: he absolutely is thrilled I bought them against his wishes, he said no way these would be good for hiking,floating,summer ect..THEY ARE THE BEES KNEES
customer_reviews.author: Melissa O

customer_reviews.title: Great footwear - worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Great sandals! Love my chacos for many different purposes - casual walks, day-to-day casual wear, or hikes. The sole on this type is a little bit thinner than on the “classic” kind by Vibram, but it is still very sturdy and is not ahowing any wear yet. Very satisfied. Good look too - bought the blue/ green pattern and the colors look sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Kena

customer_reviews.title: Too loose for my narrow feet
customer_reviews.text: I have very narrow feet. I ordered a half size less, but still too narrow. I can't tighten all the way. I can still use them causally, but not for working outdoors, like I had hoped. Still great sandals.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan W

customer_reviews.title: Clunky, heavy, and narrow
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. These are so narrow my foot spills out the sides and the soles drag my feet down. Spend your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Hat

customer_reviews.title: We also got the zcloud and he likes these better. I wish they had less tacky color options
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these. We also got the zcloud and he likes these better. I wish they had less tacky color options.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley K

customer_reviews.title: Durable Sandal
customer_reviews.text: Superbly well built and durable sandal for water and land. A bit heavy.
customer_reviews.author: NavyDavey

customer_reviews.title: Chaco
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They are my new favorites to wear. I am constantly wearing them. Vert comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Took me a few months to get use to these shoes but now I love them. Easy to get on and off. Perfect for water shoes or just wearing around the house.
customer_reviews.author: john paulley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for outdoor activities. A little wide but the straps make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted to Books

customer_reviews.title: great sandal
customer_reviews.text: All the comfort of the original Chaco’s with a lighter sole. I love wearing these for everyday activities and I wear my Chaco z2’s for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: good sandel
customer_reviews.text: Good sandel but order a half a size smaller than you would normally because they run a little big
customer_reviews.author: josh hunt holdsambeck

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, a little too heavy for my liking. Not fast to get in an out as yo have to slide the straps and buckle each time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These Chaco's were for my husband and he loves them! These are lighter in weight than normal Chaco's.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Knight

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but I still like the older styles better.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several pairs of older Chacos (Z/1, Z/2, Yampa, Unaweep) and the Z/Volv feels about a half size larger. They were just a little too big and unfortunately I already wear a size 7 so I can't go any smaller. Had to return them :( The lighter sole on these is nice but surprisingly doesn't really offer any more cushion or softness over the classics. They also don't feel quite as rugged so I'm happy to stick with my Unaweeps. I just hope Chaco doesn't switch everything to this new sole!
customer_reviews.author: Tyson

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Recommend getting a half size smaller then what you think your size is but I love it
customer_reviews.author: Jen H

customer_reviews.title: I find them very comfortable and robust
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Chaco's. I find them very comfortable and robust. Great for travel and adventure.
customer_reviews.author: D D PERCIVAL

customer_reviews.title: Narrow
customer_reviews.text: Too narrow and too heavy. Did not like these sandals but they are well made and would last a long time. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Aimes

customer_reviews.title: My second pair
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend these sandals. Tried a few others this year but this is the perfect match of weight and comfort on the footbed
customer_reviews.author: Entropylives

customer_reviews.title: Not for those with tick feet
customer_reviews.text: My son wears a size ten, he has thick feet. He could not even try these sandals on as the one strap is not adjustable and he could not feet his foot underneath it.
customer_reviews.author: Strlit66

customer_reviews.title: Two different sandals
customer_reviews.text: I got two different sandals. Hard to review properly because they're clearly different.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Chaco Men's Sport Sandal
product_meta.description: What happens when you take proven Chaco technology – like pull-through adjustable webbing straps and our LUVSEAT PU footbed – and marry it with modern design? It might look something like the Z/Volv. Featuring contemporary aesthetics, classic Chaco design features, and an airy PU compound that’s softer underfoot and 20 percent lighter than our Classic Z sandals, the Z/Volv is the ultra-light sandal you’ve always wanted.
feature_bullets: UPPER: Polyester jacquard webbing upper wraps around the foot and through the midsole for a customized fit, Adjustable and durable high-tensile webbing heel risers, Injection-molded ladder lock buckle
MIDSOLE: Women's specific LUVSEAT PU midsole, Extra-soft PU compound, Topographic textured grooves on footbed for traction
OUTSOLE: Non-marking EcoTread 25%-recycled rubber compound, 3mm lug depth
